Text.Value: Attack the family.
Wrest control from the parasite and allow the family to pass.
*You see the familiar sights of Wyrm's Crossing before the parasite shuts down the connection.*
Ready the Watcher's sword. One fewer mouth should make her life a breeze.
*Her screams for help as the Watcher draws its sword are the last thing you hear.*
*You are a mouse to an elephant, so overwhelming is the parasite's power.*
He said he was Flaming Fist - that we had to empty our pockets if we wanted to enter the city. We didn't know it was a scam!
*Of course she darts in front of the attack. Silly woman, letting yourself die will only doom your herd.*
*You are kicked from the Watcher's brain as your sword cleaves the woman's head from her shoulders, coating her screaming children in blood.*
*The family flees before you can draw it - heading for the Risen Road and, mostly likely, their deaths.*
Step to one side to let the family pass.
*You reach behind you, but the family runs before you can draw your sword - fleeing towards the Risen Road.*
*Your words are snatched away in the tempest of the parasite's power as it activates the Steel Watcher.*
Thank you, saer. Come on, kids - grab your bags. Hurry!
Wrest control from the parasite and allow the family to pass.
*You are a Steel Watcher, a guardian of Baldur's Gate - before you stands a group of humans.*
*Your tadpole eagerly responds to the parasite in the brain jar. You blink, to find yourself standing at Wyrm's Crossing.*
*You catch something squirming in the shadows of the container, but then it is gone.*
We have nothing left, and my kids are half-starved. Please, let us into the city - we have nowhere else to go.
*You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. You can only watch as you reach for your sword.*
*And, most likely, their deaths.*
*Your gears whine in protest, but you force your body to one side - gesturing for the family to enter the city.*
What - what are you doing? Kids, run! GO!
*You are kicked from the Watcher's brain. The family runs into Baldur's Gate, unnoticed by the parasite.*
HEY! STUPID PARASITE! LEAVE THEM ALONE.

Synopsis: The player connects to a brainjar that's controlling a steel watcher somewhere in the city, wielding their power over life and death.
